instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.R6905: What is R6905? Resistor between charger voltage and input to PP3V42_G3H power supply on older Macbooks, pre-2011 models. This resistor blows when C6990 has shorted to ground or U6990 has shorted to ground, and will result in PP3V42_G3H missing and the magsafe charger not having a light since PP3V42_G3H is necessary for the SMC to turn on and the onewire circuit to turn on..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came without any light on charger. After replacing <RESISTOR>R6920</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R6905</RESISTOR> which measured wrong value, i have green and orange light back. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> is missing and I have measure following values:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.4
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.41
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5.02
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.31

<CHIP>U7201</CHIP>
Pin 12 = 3.41
Pin 13 = 1.99
Pin 21 = 3.41
Pin 22 = 3.32
Pin 23 = 8.40
Pin 29 = 5.02

Resistance to ground L7260 = 0.231 both sidesResistance to ground L7220 = 0.437 both sides

Suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Check the basic signals for Power On Sequence...
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL>, 32KHz and PCH's RTC signals, <SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, etc.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Here some messures, SMC Adapter should be what voltage?

<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> at <RESISTOR>R5085</RESISTOR> = 0
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> = 0 (no bat connected though)
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> = 3.31
<SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> Pin 8 <CHIP>U7941</CHIP> = 3.40

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Be sure to use correct charger; if not <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> will be kept low (bad).
No need to connect battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Thanks for the tips, use original. Tomorrow will check more as its late here. Didnt check RTC signals yet update tomorrow how thats going and thanks for the help so far bro!
